item.title: Nobel Prize in Economics Is Awarded for Invention of New Auction Formats
item.description: U.S. academics Paul R. Milgrom and Robert B. Wilson won the Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences “for improvements to auction theory and inventions of new auction formats.”

item.title: Public-Health Experts Rethink Lockdowns as Covid Cases Surge
item.description: With case counts elevated across large parts of Europe and the U.S., officials are reluctant to force another round of nationwide lockdowns of the sort imposed in March. But this time—unlike in the spring—public-health experts broadly and increasingly agree.

item.title: EU to Sanction Russia Over Poisoning and Belarus Leader Over Crackdown
item.description: The European Union agreed Monday to impose sanctions against Russian officials allegedly involved in the poisoning of Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny and Belarus officials over the repression of protesters.

item.title: Mumbai Blackout Leaves Millions Without Power for Hours
item.description: The failure in India’s financial hub was seen as an embarrassment for the country as it seeks to attract international investment and lure manufacturing away from China.

item.title: Covid-19 Cluster in China's Qingdao Prompts City-Wide Testing
item.description: The Chinese city of Qingdao will test its more than nine million residents for Covid-19, authorities said, after the discovery of a dozen new cases linked to a local hospital—China’s most significant virus scare in months.

item.title: As Coronavirus Infections Rise in Europe, So Do Travel Restrictions
item.description: Travel in Europe is increasingly difficult as surging infections push countries to restrict or cut off travel. The European Union aims to bring order to a growing patchwork of travel rules.
